title: Replacing Notepad with Notepad 2 on XP SP3, the easiest way possible
body:
<p>After installing SP3 on XP I noticed that Notepad was reverted back to its crappy self, so I decided to write a handy batch script to install <a href="http://www.flos-freeware.ch/notepad2.html">Notepad2</a> again. This script will work in XP SP2+. Place the batch file in the same directory as notepad2.exe and run it.</p><h3>InstallNotepad2XP.bat</h3><pre>@echo offecho *IMPORTANT*echo This will kill all open instances of Notepad.echo To cancel, end this batch file now (ctrl+c), or hit any key to continue.pauseecho Killing all instances of notepad running...TASKKILL /F /IM notepad.exe /Techo Backing up...call :backup %systemroot%\servicepackfiles\i386call :backup %systemroot%call :backup %systemroot%\System32call :backup %systemroot%\System32\dllcacheecho Installing...copy notepad2.exe %systemroot%\servicepackfiles\i386
otepad.exe /ycopy notepad2.exe %systemroot%
otepad.exe /ycopy notepad2.exe %systemroot%\System32
otepad.exe /ycopy notepad2.exe %systemroot%\System32\dllcache
otepad.exe /yecho Done.pausegoto :end:backupcall set npath=%1set count=0for %%i in (%npath%
otepad.original*.exe) do (set nname=%%iset /a count=count+1)echo backing up to %npath%
otepad.original%count%.execopy %npath%
otepad.exe %npath%
otepad.original%count%.exe /y:end</pre>
